qualitative_description: The C++ candidate implements a standard NPZ structure but with some important differences from the TRUTH Python model. Uptake/growth are implemented as a simple Michaelis-Menten nutrient-limited growth (V_max * N/(K_N+N) * P) rather than the compound nutrient+light-limited term in TRUTH. Grazing is Holling type‑III (P^2/(K_P^2+P^2)) which is the same functional family used in TRUTH (P^2/(mu^2+P^2)). Nutrient recycling is present via unassimilated grazing and mortality fluxes returned to N, but the explicit environmental mixing/entrainment term (k*(N0-N)) present in TRUTH is missing. Zooplankton dynamics include assimilation of grazing and linear mortality like TRUTH, but the candidate also includes an extra quadratic zooplankton mortality term (m_Z_sq * Z^2) that is not in TRUTH. Numerical choices (forward Euler integration, epsilon flooring) and observation-error modeling are present but are non-ecological implementation details.

nutrient_equation_uptake.explanation: Candidate: "Type uptake_term = (V_max * N_prev) / (K_N + N_prev + epsilon);" and "Type total_uptake = uptake_term * P_prev;". TRUTH uses a compound form (N/(e+N))*(a/(b + c*P))*P; candidate uses standard Michaelis-Menten nutrient uptake multiplied by P (alternate).

nutrient_equation_recycling.matched_form: Recycling via unassimilated grazing + mortality returns
nutrient_equation_recycling.explanation: Candidate returns grazing and mortality to N: "Type unassimilated_grazing = (Type(1.0) - beta) * total_grazing;" and "Type dN_dt = -total_uptake + unassimilated_grazing + p_mortality_flux + z_mortality_flux;". TRUTH also returns predation and mortality fluxes to N but with different parameterization (e.g. beta*lambda_*P^2/(mu^2+P^2)*Z + gamma*q*Z + r*P). The candidate implements recycling as unassimilated_grazing + mortalities (an alternate but ecologically equivalent recycling formulation).

nutrient_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH has an explicit mixing/entrainment term: "k * (N0 - N)" in dN/dt. The candidate dN_dt contains no analogous mixing/entrainment term; no line like k*(N_external - N) is present.

phytoplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate growth is "Type total_uptake = uptake_term * P_prev;" with uptake_term = V_max * N/(K_N + N). TRUTH growth is nutrient- and light-limited: (N/(e+N))*(a/(b+c*P))*P. Candidate uses a simpler Michaelis-Menten nutrient-limited growth (alternate family).

phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.matched_form: Holling Type III grazing (P^2/(K_P^2 + P^2) * Z)
phytoplankton_equation_grazing_loss.explanation: Candidate: "Type grazing_term = (g_max * P_prev * P_prev) / (K_P * K_P + P_prev * P_prev + epsilon);" and "Type total_grazing = grazing_term * Z_prev;". TRUTH uses "(lambda_ * P^2 / (mu^2 + P^2)) * Z" — algebraically the same Holling-type III form (matching TRUTH structure).

phytoplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate: "Type p_mortality_flux = m_P * P_prev;" and dP_dt contains "- p_mortality_flux". TRUTH also contains linear losses of form "- (s + k) * P" and "- r*P"; the linear mortality structure is present and equivalent.

phytoplankton_equation_mixing.explanation: TRUTH includes physical loss via mixing/entrainment (part of "(s + k)*P" in dP/dt). The candidate has no explicit mixing/entrainment term in dP/dt (no k * P or similar), so this component is missing.

zooplankton_equation_growth.explanation: Candidate: "Type assimilated_grazing = beta * total_grazing;" and dZ_dt = assimilated_grazing - z_mortality_flux. TRUTH: "(alpha * lambda_ * P^2 / (mu^2 + P^2)) * Z" — same structure: assimilation efficiency times grazing (Holling III * Z).

zooplankton_equation_mortality.matched_form: Linear zooplankton mortality (m_Z * Z) [plus additional quadratic term present]
zooplankton_equation_mortality.explanation: Candidate includes a linear term: "Type z_mortality_flux = m_Z * Z_prev + m_Z_sq * Z_prev * Z_prev;" and dZ_dt = assimilated_grazing - z_mortality_flux. TRUTH has linear loss "- q * Z". Because the linear mortality term is present (matching TRUTH), this is scored as TRUTH_MATCH; note the candidate also includes an extra quadratic mortality term (m_Z_sq * Z^2) which is not in TRUTH (see extras).

extra_components_description: - Quadratic zooplankton mortality (m_Z_sq * Z^2) returning to nutrients: a density-dependent zooplankton loss term not present in the TRUTH NPZ model.
